meanings.definition: A highway that encircles a city or metropolitan area.
meanings.sent1: The beltway around our town makes it easy to travel from one side to the other.
meanings.sent2: During rush hour, the beltway is always congested with cars trying to get to work.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that the beltway was so busy, even the birds had to wait in traffic.
meanings.sent4: The beltway of rumors around the office spread faster than wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The beltway was like a giant loop hugging the city tightly.

meanings.definition: A political or social group that is insular and self-referential.
meanings.sent1: The members of the beltway were only interested in their own opinions and ideas.
meanings.sent2: It can be difficult to break into the beltway of elite social circles.
meanings.sent3: The beltway of gossip at school was always full of drama and secrets.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was on the outside looking in at the exclusive beltway of influencers.
meanings.sent5: The beltway of politicians seemed like a closed-off world to outsiders.
